boardgame.description: OGRE and its sequel G.E.V., are tactical ground combat games set in the not-so-distant future. In 2085 A.D., armored warfare continues - faster and deadlier than ever. Hovercraft, tanks and infantry slug it out with tactical nuclear devices. But the most feared weapon of all needs no human guidance. It's a giant cybernetic tank called the OGRE._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The basic OGRE game gives one player a force of infantry and armor, and a command post he must defend. The other player has only one unit - but it's an OGRE. It's an even match. Advanced games allow solitaire or multi-player action, with OGREs on both sides._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Microgame #1 in the Metagaming Microgames series, and the original release of Ogre. Origin of the Ogre/GEV Family._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;This is an entry on RPGG: _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;GURPS Ogre includes character and vehicle descriptions, a future timeline, a discussion of the world of the Ogres, and the Armor Unit Combat System, a quick way to resolve battles involving player characters and get back to the roleplaying!_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

listing.notes: DESCRIPTION: Marked second edition (Metagaming, 1977). Unpunched and unplayed in early plastic sleeve packaging format. A great collector_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;#039;s find!
DESCRIPTION: Marked second edition (Metagaming, 1977). Unpunched, unplayed, and complete. Early plastic sleeve (pre-ziplock) packaging format. A great collector_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s find!
2nd edition from Metagaming of the Microgame 1. Unpunched and unplayed in plastic sleeve.
1977 second edition Ogre by Metagaming. This game is punched but complete. The condition of the rules and map are like new - nearly mint. Comes in the original plastic sleeve!

OGRE/GEV: pieces cut out and baggied, missing cardboard sleeve, map cut in two [separated OGRE map and GEV map]. Shockwave, Battlefields, Reinforcements: uncut, complete, missing plastic bag. NB: this BGG marketplace offer is exclusively for cnd_77.
Components are like new to new condition. Never played but some counters have been punched/cut with care. Ogre/G.E.V 5th Edition.
Ogre Miniatures, never used: Combine Set 3, 4, 5, and 7. Paneuro starter set (map, rules, 46 miniatures) and sets 2 and 4. 46+16+8+8+15+64+12=169 unpainted miniatures.
Ogre G.E.V. by Steve Jackson Games; New in shrinkwrap; Will include Ogre Miniatures Set #2: Spawn of Ogrethulhu as a bonus (opened - like new).
DESCRIPTION: 100% complete 1977 second edition, second printing (stylish orange Biran Wilson cover art). 39 counters have been carefully cut out. A nice copy of this early edition.

Deluxe Ogre, the 1987 edition. Punched, complete and in excellent shape. The box top is a bit dished from shelfwear. If you have any questions (shipping, pics, etc.) just email me at danger-mouse@comcast.net.

this is the later version in the black plastic box. Looks brand new. Counters punched and in ziplock bags inside. Excellent copy of this true classic. I also have GEV in the same style black plastic box, same condition, that I would sell together or separate.

This is not the first (and awfully produced) version of Ogre, but the much more durable and attractive [b]OGRE: DELUXE[/b] version. Printed in 1987, this version was the first to include a [b]hard board-mounted map[[/b] (rather than the cheap flimsy folded paper map of the original) and [b]stand-up[/b] counters. Image of the cover can be found here: http://boardgamegeek.com/image/17788/ogre Condition is Good. Box has seen some wear, and one side is sun-faded. But the board and playing pieces are complete, and in lovely shape. I will ship USPS Priority Mail, and include Delivery Confirmation, so you can enjoy total peace of mind that this collectible and sought-after game will arrive safely at your doorstep.
*reserved for stophle as part of european auction* £8 plus postage

First edition..._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;white_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039; cover. Pristine. Still in original plastic sleeve. Very cherry collectible.

This is a complete set of the miniatures from both the Deluxe Ogre and Deluxe GEV sets. This would be an excellent start on an OGRE minis collection and includes many minis that are no longer available from SJG. There are (mostly) no maps, rules, or other materials included. The only other parts I have are 1 of the 6 (?) VHS-style cases originally included as well as the original slipcases for both games - those are yours if you want them, but may require a bigger shipping box. The minis included are: Deluxe OGRE Ogre Mk. III (Combine Forces) Command Post 6 GEV_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s 4 Hvy Tanks 4 Msl Tanks 1 Howitzer 21 Infantry 10 Bases Deluxe GEV (Paneuro Forces) Command Post 6 GEV 6 Lt GEV 1 Super Hvy Tank 4 Hvy Tanks 4 Msl Tanks 4 Lt Tanks 1 Howitzer 1 Mobile Howitzer 18 Infantry 8 Bases Retail on these would be approximately $130 from Warehouse 23, but a large portion of them have been out-of-print for quite some time. Shipping should be around $6-11, depending on whether you want the slipcases and VHS case or just the minis.
Reserved for gamers88.

This is the Ogre Deluxe edition. The one that does NOT have the miniatures. (Deluxe Ogre is the one w/minis.) All parts there and in great condition. Board and rules are clean. Box is caved and a bit beat up. I am always open to negotiation or trade.
Reserved for Dave Hamrick (evadimus)

SJG Pocket Box edition. The counters have been cut but are all present. The map has a small hole in it, but is otherwise decent. The box has a thin piece cracked out of it, but it still works, and I can provide a box from another game if desired.
Deluxe Edition. Unpunched. All components including the box in excellent condition.

Listing for lordarach only. Deluxe Edition, complete. You get 38 miniatures, unassembled and unpainted. Miniatures include Ogre Mk III, 4 heavy tanks, 4 missile tanks, 6 GEV_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s, 1 howitzer, 1 command post and 21 infantry figures with 10 triple bases. Rules and record sheets in like-new condition. Map is a giant 35 in. x 22 in., full-color, has slight tears and wrinkles. Box (really more of a sleeve) has a large crease down the middle, is wrinkled and shows significant shelf wear.

KICKSTARTER VERSION, with all the goodies, like the canvas bag, a T-shirt (L), Pocket Ogre, extra tile sheets, etc. Plus, I bought an extra set of 4 dice (so 6 total, 3 red and 3 blue) and extra KS sheets. I purchased extra copies of: - KS Exclusive Overlays (2 sheets) (Actually, they have have given us two copies of these. One way or the other, I have two copies of these two sheets.) - Targets Go Boom (2 sheets) - Vulcan _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; Friends (2 sheets) I also purchased from the Geek Store: - BGG 3-D Units (1 sheet) - BGG Exclusive Overlays (2 sheets) PLUS, all the stuff the KS came with. I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;m not sure exactly what was exclusive versus what_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s in the retail box, but I know there_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s a lot! The game has been opened but is unpunched and unplayed. It will ship in the same shipping carton in which it shipped to me. (Actually, it came in two boxes and it may have to come to you in two as well.) I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;m listing it for the price I paid… I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;m just trying to recoup my cost. Even though the buyer will have to pay shipping for a notoriously heavy game, this is still a great deal for someone that missed the KS campaign.

Ogre Designer_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s Kickstarter edition (certificate included) with approximately 10,000,000,000 extra pieces. Game is punched but unplayed and in excellent condition. Shipping is in original shipping box via FedEx Ground for $25 insured. Domestic buyers only.

Ogre Pocket Edn - third edition 1978 AND GEV Pocket Edition 1978 Both the Ogre and GEV maps have been laminated onto thick card backing. Steve Jackson Games (SJG1112) Ogre was Steve Jackson_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s first game. Originally published in 1977, it became a hit as the first _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Microgame,_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; and is now considered a classic. Over 25 years after its release, it earned a spot in James Lowder_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s popular book Hobby Games: The 100 Best. In 2013, Steve Jackson Games released the Designer_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s Edition of Ogre... a 28 pound box with giant maps and nearly a thousand counters, retailing for $100. Now Pocket Ogre takes the game back to its roots: a small rulebook, 140 counters, and the same bare-bones map Steve drew himself for the very first printing. And the price is the same as it has always been: $2.95. This isn_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t meant as a collector_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s item, though. It_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s a tense, very playable game that can fit in your pocket, and come out any time you_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ve got a spare half-hour. It was a good idea in 1977, and it_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s a good idea now!
